thread.title: Maris the beluga whale dies suddenly at Georgia Aquarium
thread.title_full: Maris the beluga whale dies suddenly at Georgia Aquarium - CNN.com

author: Faith Karimi
title: Maris the beluga whale dies suddenly at Georgia Aquarium
text:
Story highlights Maris, 21, showed no signs of illness before her death "This is a case of sudden, acute animal death," chief vet says Atlanta (CNN) A beloved female beluga whale has died suddenly at the Georgia Aquarium in Atlanta.
Maris, 21, showed no signs of illness before her death Thursday, the aquarium said in a statement.
She ate and interacted normally with Grayson and Qinu, the other two beluga whales at the aquarium.
"This is a case of sudden, acute animal death," said Dr. Gregory Bossart, chief vet at the Georgia Aquarium.
An autopsy is underway.
Read More Fisheries experts at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration estimate that beluga whales often live to be 35 to 50 years of age in the wild.
We're profoundly saddened to announce the sudden loss of our 21 yr. old beluga whale, Maris. https://t.co/ZyLihvxLvg pic.twitter.com/fQeGq6MLyx
â€” Georgia Aquarium (@GeorgiaAquarium) October 22, 2015 Maris lived at the aquarium for 10 years, and had a calf this year that died in June shortly after birth.
She came to Atlanta from the New York Aquarium, where she was born.
SeaWorld can expand tank but not breed whales, board rules
